thread.title: 12th annual Golf Challenge will raise $100K for children's charities
thread.title_full: 12th annual Golf Challenge will raise $100K for children's charities

author: Gary Curreri
title: 12th annual Golf Challenge will raise $100K for children's charities
text:
More than 400 golfers will take part in the 12th annual Boca West Children’s Foundation Golf Challenge at Boca West Country Club on March 25.
Children’s charities, more than 30 nonprofits from throughout Palm Beach County, will benefit from the day-long event, which is expected to sell out.
“The Golf Challenge is an annual fundraiser and so many people from the community participate in our shared effort to support local kids,” said Pamela Weinroth, executive director of Boca West Children’s Foundation . “Non-golfers can support the effort and join in the fun by attending the cocktail reception and dinner.”
Taking place at Boca West Country Club, 20583 Boca West Drive, registration and brunch begins at 11 a.m. Hundreds of plastic yellow ducks will dropped from a crane during the duck drop at 12:30 p.m. in which participants have a chance to win $2,500.
Joe Cavaretta/South Florida Sun Sentinel Over 700 rubber ducks are dropped on the green during a previous Golf Challenge that benefits the Boca West Children’s Foundation’s children’s charities. (Joe Cavaretta/South Florida Sun Sentinel) The Golf Challenge starts at 1 p.m. and will be followed by a 5:30 p.m. cocktail reception, dinner and live auction.
Charities will vie for a portion of the $100,000 awarded during the tournament. Each charity will receive between $3,000 and $15,000 depending on its team’s placement.
Since its inception, the foundation has granted more than $18 million for projects that serve at-risk youth.
Visit bocawestfoundation.org to purchase tickets and ducks. Call 561-488-6980 or email foundation@bocawestcc.org .
